thread.title: Drone drops Burger King Whoppers to feed the homeless in San Francisco
thread.title_full: Drone drops Burger King Whoppers to feed the homeless in San Francisco | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Drone drops Burger King Whoppers to feed the homeless in San Francisco
text:
16 shares
View
comments
It's a delivery service that's really taken off.
In San Francisco a Good Samaritan flies Burger King whoppers by drones to the homeless.
A video shows the craft sailing through the skies then dropping off fast food to people below.
The Whopper Dropper! Drone delivers burgers to homeless people Fondly named the 'Whopper Dropper,' the device can be seen being loaded up with wrappes burgers before being flown around the parks and streets
When the charitable drone operator spies someone who 'looks hungry,' a tasty parcel is released
Fondly named the 'Whopper Dropper,' footage shows the device being loaded up with burgers before being flown around the parks and streets.
When the charitable drone operator spies someone who 'looks hungry,' a tasty parcel is released.

Share this article Share 16 shares The recipients look both confused and delighted at their unexpected meal, with one even doing a celebratory dance.
The spirit of goodwill is sometimes passed on, with one man seen handing his burger to someone else.
In 2013 it was estimated there were 6,346 homeless people in the city with 914, unaccompanied children.
The recipients look both confused and delighted at their unexpected meal, with one even doing a celebratory dance
The video of the free burgers being distributed was uploaded to YouTube last year
